edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    Class defines state and behavior for Schedule object to maintain an ArrayList of courses. Class features basic add, remove and reset functionality as well as set/get functionality for schedule title.
    Author:
    Nick Garner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ArrayList<Course> schedule
      ArrayList of courses to manipulate
      private java.lang.String title
      Title of the schedule object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schedule()
      Null constructor creates an empty ArrayList of courses and sets schedule title to "My Schedule"

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course c)
      Adds course to the end of the schedule if it is not a duplicate or conflicting
      boolean canAdd(Course c)
      Checks if a Course is null, a duplicate, or conflicts with another Activity on the schedule and returns false if so.
      int getScheduleCredits()
      Returns the total number of credits of all the Courses currently on the schedule
      java.lang.String[][] getScheduledCourses()
      Returns a 2D string array of the schedule with each course's name, section, title, and meeting information.
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Returns the current title of the schedule as a String
      boolean removeCourseFromSchedule(Course c)
      Searches the schedule for a Course matching the parameter's name and removes if found.
      void resetSchedule()
      Resets the schedule to an empty ArrayList with default capacity and title
      void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
      Sets schedule title to the given String if not null

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Schedule

        public Schedule()
        Null constructor creates an empty ArrayList of courses and sets schedule title to "My Schedule"

    • Method Detail

      • addCourseToSchedule

        public boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course c)
        Adds course to the end of the schedule if it is not a duplicate or conflicting
        Parameters:
        c - The course to add
        Returns:
        Returns true if course is successfully added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If course is a duplicate or creates a schedule conflict

      • removeCourseFromSchedule

        public boolean removeCourseFromSchedule(Course c)
        Searches the schedule for a Course matching the parameter's name and removes if found.
        Parameters:
        c - The course to remove
        Returns:
        Returns true if course was successfully removed, false otherwise

      • resetSchedule

        public void resetSchedule()
        Resets the schedule to an empty ArrayList with default capacity and title

      • getScheduledCourses

        public java.lang.String[][] getScheduledCourses()
        Returns a 2D string array of the schedule with each course's name, section, title, and meeting information.
        Returns:
        Returns 2D string array with course name, section, title, and meeting information for every course in schedule.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets schedule title to the given String if not null
        Parameters:
        title - The String to set the schedule title to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If given String is null

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns the current title of the schedule as a String
        Returns:
        Returns the title of the schedule

      • getScheduleCredits

        public int getScheduleCredits()
        Returns the total number of credits of all the Courses currently on the schedule
        Returns:
        Returns the total number of credits currently on the schedule

      • canAdd

        public boolean canAdd(Course c)
        Checks if a Course is null, a duplicate, or conflicts with another Activity on the schedule and returns false if so.
        Parameters:
        c - Course to check for eligibility to add to schedule.
        Returns:
        True if course can be added, false if course is null, duplicate, or conflicts with schedule.
